title: Data objects for Tukelator
text: marks object main tibble type Tukelator app. row mark, following columns needed: id: student ID, name: student name, course_id: course code form discipline-catalog_number, course_name: course name, year: year offering, term: term offering, form Sem 1 etc, mark: mark (integer), grade: grade mark, raa: RAA code - e.g. UR10.
code: head(example_marks) #>        id               name  course_id     course_name year  term mark grade #> 1 8987019      Bolton, Molly MATHS-3015 Comm Skills III 2016 Sem 2   79     D #> 2 8387540     Iranfar, Tyree MATHS-3015 Comm Skills III 2016 Sem 2   86    HD #> 3 1939740 Schuettpelz, Sarah MATHS-3015 Comm Skills III 2016 Sem 2   77     D #> 4 6370923  Sandoval, Araceli MATHS-3015 Comm Skills III 2016 Sem 2   90    HD #> 5 4795219      Long, Jessica MATHS-3015 Comm Skills III 2016 Sem 2   65     C #> 6 4107044    Dilisio, Lauren MATHS-3015 Comm Skills III 2016 Sem 2   58     P #>    raa #> 1 <NA> #> 2 <NA> #> 3 <NA> #> 4 <NA> #> 5 <NA> #> 6 <NA>

title: Authors and Citation
text: Tuke J (2024). tukelatoR: Code analysis exam marks University Adelaide. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://jonotuke.github.io/tukelatoR/, https://github.com/jonotuke/tukelatoR.
code: @Manual{,   title = {tukelatoR: Code to analysis exam marks for University of Adelaide},   author = {Jono Tuke},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://jonotuke.github.io/tukelatoR/},   url = {https://github.com/jonotuke/tukelatoR}, }

what: Code to analysis exam marks for University of Adelaide
title: Code to analysis exam marks for University of Adelaide
text: goal tukelatoR give code moderate exams University Adelaide.

title: Code to analysis exam marks for University of Adelaide
text: can install development version tukelatoR GitHub :

title: Code to analysis exam marks for University of Adelaide
text: three main data sources Tukelator: peoplesoft data, grade-rosters, grade-books. function parse correct form needed Tukelator app. form need rectangular dataset one row mark. variables recorded

title: augment_mark_obj — augment_mark_obj
code: augment_mark_obj(example_marks) #> # A tibble: 24,446 × 12 #>    id      name  course_id course_name  year term   mark grade raa       N  mean #>    <chr>   <chr> <glue>    <chr>       <dbl> <chr> <dbl> <chr> <chr> <int> <dbl> #>  1 8987019 Bolt… MATHS-30… Comm Skill…  2016 Sem 2    79 D     NA        9  71.1 #>  2 8387540 Iran… MATHS-30… Comm Skill…  2016 Sem 2    86 HD    NA        4  74.5 #>  3 1939740 Schu… MATHS-30… Comm Skill…  2016 Sem 2    77 D     NA        9  61   #>  4 6370923 Sand… MATHS-30… Comm Skill…  2016 Sem 2    90 HD    NA       12  90.8 #>  5 4795219 Long… MATHS-30… Comm Skill…  2016 Sem 2    65 C     NA       11  47.6 #>  6 4107044 Dili… MATHS-30… Comm Skill…  2016 Sem 2    58 P     NA        4  38.5 #>  7 5387980 Mitc… MATHS-30… Comm Skill…  2016 Sem 2    NA WNF   NA       11  54.3 #>  8 3200260 Bald… MATHS-30… Comm Skill…  2016 Sem 2    61 P     NA       16  53.6 #>  9 0449948 Walk… MATHS-30… Comm Skill…  2016 Sem 2    78 D     NA       14  76.2 #> 10 1346648 el-M… MATHS-30… Comm Skill…  2016 Sem 2    71 C     NA        4  53   #> # ℹ 24,436 more rows #> # ℹ 1 more variable: diff <dbl>

title: augmented_example_marks — augmented_example_marks
text: simulated tibble showing standard mark-object form

title: augmented_example_marks — augmented_example_marks
text: data frame 24,431 rows 11 variables id Student ID name Student Name course_name Course Name course_id Course ID form DISPLINE-CAT_NO year Year offering term Term offering mark Mark course NA WNF etc. grade Grade raa RAA note N Number exams mark student mean Mean exam mark diff Difference mark mean marks given student

title: calc_grade — calc_grade
code: calc_grade(c("FNS", "WNF", "RP", "WF", 0:100)) #>   [1] FNS WNF RP  WF  FNS F   F   F   F   F   F   F   F   F   F   F   F   F   #>  [19] F   F   F   F   F   F   F   F   F   F   F   F   F   F   F   F   F   F   #>  [37] F   F   F   F   F   F   F   F   F   F   F   F   F   F   F   F   F   F   #>  [55] P   P   P   P   P   P   P   P   P   P   P   P   P   P   P   C   C   C   #>  [73] C   C   C   C   C   C   C   D   D   D   D   D   D   D   D   D   D   HD  #>  [91] HD  HD  HD  HD  HD  HD  HD  HD  HD  HD  HD  HD  HD  HD  HD  #> Levels: Unknown NFE RP NGP PNG WF WNF FNS F P C D HD

title: count_acad_supps — count_acad_supps
text: mark_obj mark obj course_id course id year year term term

title: example_marks — example_marks
text: simulated tibble showing standard mark-object form

title: example_marks — example_marks
text: data frame 24,431 rows 8 variables id Student ID name Student Name course_name Course Name course_id Course ID form DISPLINE-CAT_NO year Year offering term Term offering mark Mark course NA WNF etc. grade Grade raa RAA note

title: get_grade_tab — get_grade_tab
text: mark_obj standard mark tibble course_id course-id term term

title: get_grade_tab — get_grade_tab
code: get_grade_tab(example_marks, course_id = "STATS-3001", term = "Sem 1")     year       term       WF       WNF       F       P       C       D       HD       N     Statistical Modelling III     2017 Sem 1 0.03 [1] — 0.03 [1] 0.2 [6] 0.17 [5] 0.23 [7] 0.33 [10] 302016 Sem 1 — 0.04 [1] 0.12 [3] 0.15 [4] 0.12 [3] 0.31 [8] 0.27 [7] 26

title: get_mark_tab — get_mark_tab
text: augmented_mark_obj augmented-mark-obj course_id course-id term term year year offering

title: get_mark_tab — get_mark_tab
parse_grade_roster — parse_grade_roster
text: filename CSV XLSX grade-roster year year offering

title: parse section — parse_section
text: x gradebook section column return, term course_id

title: parse section — parse_section
code: section <- c(   "Workshop WR01 Class 4320_STATS_3022",    "Workshop WR01 Class 4320_APP MTH_3022",   "Workshop WR01 Class 4320_APP-MTH_3022" ) parse_section(section, "term") #> [1] "4320" "4320" "4320" parse_section(section, "course_id") #> [1] "STATS_3022"   "APP MTH_3022" "APP-MTH_3022"

title: plot_fail_rate — plot_fail_rate
code: plot_fail_rate(mark_obj, course_id, year, term, MS, MSPR, ASPR)

title: plot_fail_rate — plot_fail_rate
text: mark_obj standard mark tibble course_id course-id year year latest results term term latest results MS number medical supps MSPR medical supp pass rate ASPR academic supp pass rate

title: plot_grade_bc — plot_grade_bc
text: mark_obj standard mark tibble course_id course-id term term all_grades Show grades

title: plot_grade_bc — plot_grade_bc
code: plot_grade_bc(example_marks, course_id = "STATS-3001", term = "Sem 1")  plot_grade_bc(example_marks, course_id = c("STATS-3001", "STATS-3006"), term = "Sem 1")

title: predict_fail_rate — predict_fail_rate
text: NF number fails based grades MS number medical supps number academic supps MSPR medical supp expected pass rate ASPR academic supp expected pass rate

title: term_codes — term_codes
text: data frame 300 rows 2 variables: term Term code name Term name

title: tukelator app — tukelatorApp
text: mark_obj mark object tibble term selected term
